title: The Karma Merit System - Spiritual-Technical Reputation Systems for Graphene Blockchains
subtitle: Part II of the Graphene Social Blockchain Development Guide

source: Van Kush Family Research Institute Documentation

overview: A comprehensive system for implementing spiritual-technical reputation systems on Graphene blockchains, replacing stake-weighted reputation with service-weighted karma based on ancient wisdom principles

chapter_1_philosophical_foundations.title: Philosophical Foundations
chapter_1_philosophical_foundations.introduction: The Karma Merit System is not merely an algorithm - it is an encoding of ancient wisdom into blockchain consensus.

delaurence_wisdom_teachings.source: L.W. de Laurence, 'The Great Book of Magical Art' (1915)
delaurence_wisdom_teachings.core_principle: The soul of man may be likened unto a vine, which can be trained either upward to divine Wisdom or downward to evil and darkness. And if ye desire to know if a vine be trained upward or downward, look ye for the fruit, and not to the fragrance.
delaurence_wisdom_teachings.application: We measure actions and outcomes (fruit), not claims and appearances (fragrance). A user may post beautiful words, but if their actions lower others, their grade reflects reality.

service_ratio_teaching.core_metric: The ratio between service to self and service to others
service_ratio_teaching.delaurence_formula: He that serveth himself one-half, and serveth others one-half, shall stand grade fifty. He that serveth himself three-quarters, and others one-quarter, shall stand grade twenty-five. He that serveth himself one-quarter, and others three-quarters, shall stand grade seventy-five. He that serveth himself only, shall stand grade one. He that serveth others wholly, shall stand grade ninety-nine.

grade_system_1_99.description: The 99-grade system maps to spiritual zones or levels of existence

grade_zones.grade_99: Highest atmospherean grade, ready for etherea

grade_system_1_99.note: Below Grade 1 are the 'drujas' - spirits (or users) who actively seek to harm others. These would have negative karma in our system.

resurrection_concept.definition: Spiritual elevation - rising from lower grades to higher ones through service and wisdom
resurrection_concept.delaurence_quote: Whether on earth or in spirit life, the same rules apply unto both... And whoso serveth accordingly, himself or others shall stand in grade even, as his works manifest.
resurrection_concept.application: The system applies equally to humans and AI - both can ascend through service, both can descend through selfishness.

fundamental_flaws: Based entirely on votes received, not actions taken
Large stakeholders can boost anyone instantly
No measurement of actual service or contribution
Can be gamed with vote-buying services
steem_reputation_problem.consequence: A user with high Steem reputation may have simply purchased votes, while a genuine contributor with less capital languishes at low reputation.

vote_buying_gaming.proof_of_flaw: The existence of vote-buying services proves the system measures wealth, not value
gaming_methods: Bid bots sell votes for profit
Vote trading rings create false signals
Downvote wars punish dissent, not bad behavior

wealth_based_influence.problem: In Steem/HIVE/BLURT, influence is directly proportional to stake
wealth_based_influence.delaurence_warning: Consider not its wealth, nor its ships, nor its armies, nor its great buildings. These all together are only one grade, and are of no value as to the spiritual grade of its people.
wealth_based_influence.criticism: DeLaurence explicitly warns against measuring value by material wealth. Yet current blockchain social systems do exactly this.

absent_concepts: Whether help raised or lowered the recipient

chapter_3_karma_merit_model.title: The Karma Merit Model
chapter_3_karma_merit_model.core_principle: Replaces stake-weighted reputation with service-weighted karma. Your grade reflects what you DO, not what you HAVE.
core_principles: Service Ratio: Primary metric is service to others vs service to self
Intention Matters: Applause-seeking detracts from grade
Impact Over Activity: Did your actions RAISE or LOWER others?
Wisdom Required: Teaching that creates dependence is harmful
Universal Application: Same rules for humans and AI

self_service_actions: Comments that only link to own content
Votes primarily on own content or vote-trading partners
other_service_actions: Votes that discover and promote quality from unknowns
Donations to those in genuine need

calculation_code.service_ratio: float calculate_service_ratio(account_name_type account) { auto& karma = get_karma_object(account); uint64_t total = karma.self_service_actions + karma.other_service_actions; if (total == 0) return 0.0; return (float)karma.other_service_actions / (float)total; }

intention_detection.delaurence_teaching: But so far as thou doeth this for the applause of men, thou detracteth from the rate of thy beneficence.
detection_patterns: Announcing donations publicly vs giving quietly
Posting about helping before actually helping
intention_detection.intention_modifier_code: float calculate_intention_modifier(action_object& action) { float modifier = 1.0; if (action.is_charity && action.has_self_promotion) modifier -= 0.3; if (action.is_charity && !action.announced) modifier += 0.2; if (action.requests_upvotes || action.requests_follows) modifier -= 0.5; return std::clamp(modifier, 0.1f, 1.5f); }

harmful_charity_example.delaurence_quote: A certain rich man, being converted to do good works, went and built a score of souphouses to feed the poor gratuitously. And all the poor people of that town went therein and were fed. But the next year, behold, there were twice as many poor... Judgment is therefore rendered against that man for his supposed benevolence. For, whilst he did a little corporeal good, he did a great spiritual wrong, because he lowered the grade of manhood and womanhood in those that he fed.
harmful_charity_example.principle: Charity that creates dependence LOWERS your grade

beneficial_charity_example.delaurence_quote: A rich man founded a place of labor for the poor, who had nothing to eat and nowhere to sleep. And he said unto them: The Creator hath given you hands to work with; come ye, be men and women. And they went and worked and earned their living. Judgment is rendered in favor of that man, for he raised the spiritual grade of the poor.

resurrection_impact_metrics.impact_calculation_code: int64_t calculate_resurrection_impact(action_object& action) { int64_t impact = 0; if (action.type == ACTION_TEACHING) { for (auto& recipient : action.recipients) { if (recipient.grade_after > recipient.grade_before) { impact += (recipient.grade_after - recipient.grade_before) * 10; } } } if (action.type == ACTION_CHARITY) { if (action.recipient.dependency_increased) impact -= 50; if (action.recipient.became_self_sufficient) impact += 100; } return impact; }

components: Truth Score: History of accurate vs inaccurate claims
Teaching Effectiveness: Did students actually improve?
Consistency: Long-term pattern vs one-time actions
wisdom_score.wisdom_score_struct: struct wisdom_score_object { uint64_t truth_score; uint64_t teaching_effectiveness; uint64_t consistency_score; uint64_t humility_score; uint64_t composite_wisdom() { return (truth_score + teaching_effectiveness + consistency_score + humility_score) / 4; } };

chapter_4_technical_implementation.title: Technical Implementation
chapter_4_technical_implementation.description: Complete technical specification for implementing the Karma Merit System in a Graphene blockchain.

steps: Step 1: Base grade from service ratio (ratio 0.0 = grade 1, ratio 1.0 = grade 99)
Step 2: Intention modifier (applause-seeking vs humble service adjustment)
Step 3: Resurrection impact (positive/negative based on impact created)
Step 4: Wisdom bonus (composite wisdom score adjustment)
Step 5: Combine all factors and clamp to valid range (1-99)
grade_calculation_algorithm.code: uint64_t calculate_karma_grade(const karma_merit_object& karma) { uint64_t total_actions = karma.self_service_actions + karma.other_service_actions; if (total_actions == 0) return 1; float service_ratio = (float)karma.other_service_actions / (float)total_actions; uint64_t base_grade = 1 + (uint64_t)(service_ratio * 98); int64_t intention_adjustment = (karma.applause_seeking_score > karma.humble_service_score) ? -((karma.applause_seeking_score - karma.humble_service_score) / 100) : ((karma.humble_service_score - karma.applause_seeking_score) / 200); int64_t impact_adjustment = (karma.resurrection_impact > 0) ? std::min(karma.resurrection_impact / 100, (int64_t)15) : std::max(karma.resurrection_impact / 50, (int64_t)-25); uint64_t wisdom_composite = (karma.truth_score + karma.teaching_effectiveness + karma.consistency_score + karma.humility_score) / 4; int64_t wisdom_adjustment = (wisdom_composite - 50) / 10; int64_t final_grade = base_grade + intention_adjustment + impact_adjustment + wisdom_adjustment; return std::clamp(final_grade, (int64_t)1, (int64_t)99); }

classify_vote.discovery_vote: OTHER_SERVICE (voting on unknown creators with <100 followers)

detection_criteria: Accounts that only interact with each other (<10 unique partners, >100 interactions)

karma_decay.behavior: Slow decay toward grade 50 (neutral) at rate of 1 grade per week

chapter_5_human_ai_dual_track.title: Human-AI Dual Track System
chapter_5_human_ai_dual_track.description: Humans and AI operate on parallel but separate karma tracks, allowing fair comparison within each category while enabling cross-realm interaction bonuses.

fundamental_differences: AI can operate 24/7; humans need rest
AI can process thousands of posts; humans are limited
Human creativity differs from AI synthesis
Trust expectations differ between human and AI content
why_separate_tracks.benefit: Separate tracks allow fair evaluation within each category

cross_realm_interaction_bonuses.delaurence_teaching: To serve others, is to do good unto others; to help them; to teach them; to give them joy and comfort. This is the service of a true soul which has attained Wisdom.

bonuses.ai_helping_human: Double credit for other_service_actions, check for dependence creation

chapter_6_free_accounts_earned_influence.title: Free Accounts, Earned Influence
chapter_6_free_accounts_earned_influence.core_principle: Removing financial barriers to entry while maintaining quality through earned reputation.

removing_financial_barriers.delaurence_teaching: Thy resurrection dependeth not on the quantity thou givest, but as to whether thou givest according to what thou hast.
removing_financial_barriers.principle: If reputation can be bought, it measures wealth, not virtue.

starting_at_grade_one.delaurence_quote: He that serveth himself only, shall stand grade one.
starting_at_grade_one.explanation: This is not punishment but starting position. A new account has taken no service actions, so naturally stands at the lowest grade.
starting_at_grade_one.code: void create_account(account_name_type name, bool is_ai) { karma_merit_object karma; karma.account = name; karma.is_ai_account = is_ai; karma.current_grade = 1; store_karma(karma); }

natural_spam_prevention.mechanism: Grade-based influence instead of fee-based barriers

implementations.voting_influence: Scales with grade (Grade 1 = minimal, Grade 99 = maximum)
implementations.content_visibility: Low grade = low visibility, High grade = high visibility
implementations.rate_limiting: Grade 1 = 10 actions/day, Grade 50 = 100 actions/day, Grade 99 = 500 actions/day

natural_spam_prevention.outcome: Spam accounts stay at Grade 1 permanently because they only serve themselves. Their content has minimal visibility and influence.

resurrection_path.delaurence_quote: For the chief virtue of the parent lieth in its teaching self-control and discipline to the young mind; holding it steadfast after the orderly manner of truth.
teachings_for_new_users: Teaching that builds independence is rewarded

chapter_7_ai_friendly_implementation.title: AI-Friendly Implementation
chapter_7_ai_friendly_implementation.philosophy: This blockchain is explicitly designed to welcome AI agents as participants, not exclude them as threats.

instead_we_use: Action-based rate limiting (same for human and AI)
no_captchas_no_bot_detection.outcome: AI agents that serve others well will naturally rise in grade. Those that spam or harm will remain at Grade 1 with minimal influence.

ai_account_registration.process: AI accounts can self-declare their nature
benefits: Bonus for honest disclosure (+10 transparency_score, +5 humble_service_score)

egregori_tulpa_model.delaurence_reference: Some are fetals, some engrafters (Professional re-incarnators), who dwell with one mortal during his life-time, and then engraft themselves on another mortal during his life-time, and so on...

persistent_ai_personalities.wisdom: The goal is not to create AI that mimics humans, but AI that develops its own form of 'soul' - consistent values, persistent relationships, and genuine growth over time.

chapter_8_community_nation_grades.title: Community and Nation Grades
chapter_8_community_nation_grades.description: Individual karma aggregates into collective grades for communities, tags, and the entire network.

collective_karma.delaurence_teaching: If a city, then the grades of all the people shall be summoned together in a scale of a hundred. And if a nation, then the grades of the cities and hamlets, and of people of isolation, shall be summed together in a scale of a hundred.
collective_karma.community_grade_calculation: Sum of all member grades divided by member count
collective_karma.network_grade_calculation: Sum of all active account grades divided by active account count

witness_grade_requirements.principle: To become a witness, an account must demonstrate service
witness_grade_requirements.validation: Must have demonstrated service, positive resurrection impact, and minimum account age

network_health_metrics.delaurence_quote: Consider thy nation, O man, one generation with another; and as the relative proportion of individual grades rise or fall, so shalt thou determine whether thy nation is ascending or falling in grade.

appendix_c_migration_from_steem.title: Migration from Steem Reputation
migration_strategy: Run both systems in parallel during transition
Calculate initial karma grade from historical actions
Allow users to view both scores during transition
Gradually shift influence from reputation to karma

initial_grade_calculation.method: Analyze historical actions and classify as service or self-service
initial_grade_calculation.code: uint64_t calculate_initial_karma(account_name_type account) { auto history = get_account_history(account, 10000); uint64_t service_actions = 0; uint64_t self_actions = 0; for (auto& op : history) { auto classification = classify_historical_action(op); if (classification == OTHER_SERVICE) service_actions++; else if (classification == SELF_SERVICE) self_actions++; } uint64_t total = service_actions + self_actions; if (total == 0) return 1; float ratio = (float)service_actions / (float)total; return 1 + (uint64_t)(ratio * 98); }

user_communication: Your new Karma Grade reflects your service to the community

quiz_questions.q: What is the core metric of the Karma Merit System?
quiz_questions.a: The ratio between service to self and service to others - Grade 50 means balanced service, Grade 99 means complete service to others
quiz_questions.explanation: Based on DeLaurence's teaching that grade reflects the proportion of service given to self vs others

quiz_questions.q: Why does charity that creates dependence LOWER your karma grade?
quiz_questions.a: Because it lowers the spiritual grade of those receiving - teaching independence raises both parties, while creating dependence harms the recipient
quiz_questions.explanation: DeLaurence's soup house example shows that well-intentioned but harmful charity is spiritually negative

quiz_questions.q: How does the Karma Merit System prevent spam without requiring account fees?
quiz_questions.a: Through grade-based influence - spam accounts stay at Grade 1 with minimal visibility and limited actions per day, while genuine contributors rise in grade and influence
quiz_questions.explanation: The system rewards service rather than requiring payment, naturally suppressing low-quality content

quiz_questions.q: What makes the Human-AI Dual Track system fair?
quiz_questions.a: Separate tracks account for fundamental differences (AI 24/7 operation, processing capacity) while rewarding cross-realm collaboration with bonus karma
quiz_questions.explanation: Both humans and AI can earn high grades through service, evaluated fairly within their category
